intro: Calothamnus tuberosus, commonly known as the tuberous calothamnus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Calothamnus tuberosus is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions.
